text: Charles Curtis "Buck" Pattillo (June 3, 1924 â€“ May 20, 2019) was an American Air Force lieutenant general. He was deputy commander in chief, U.S. Readiness Command and vice director of the Joint Deployment Agency with headquarters at MacDill Air Force Base, Florida. In 1953, he helped organize and then flew left wing for the U.S. Air Force demonstration team, the "Thunderbirds". He was born in Atlanta, Georgia. His twin brother was Cuthbert A. Pattillo. Pattillo died on May 20, 2019, at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American generals Category:People from Atlanta Category:United States Air Force Category:Twin people from the United States Category:Military people from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Charles C. Pattillo
